action.action-desc: Mr. Amodei introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To quitclaim surface rights to certain Federal land under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Land Management in Virginia City, Nevada, to Storey County, Nevada, to resolve conflicting ownership and title claims, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Restoring Storey County Act .

paragraph.text: The Federal Government owns real property in Storey County in the State of Nevada.
While the real property described in paragraph (1) is under the jurisdiction of the Secretary, some of the real property has been occupied for decades by individuals—

subparagraph.text: the continued occupation by whom constitutes a trespass on the title held by the Federal Government.

paragraph.text: As a result of the confused and conflicting ownership claims, the real property described in paragraph (1)—

subparagraph.text: is difficult to manage under multiple use policies; and
creates a continuing source of friction and unease between the Federal Government and local residents.

paragraph.text: All of the real property described in paragraph (1) is appropriate for disposal for the purpose of promoting administrative efficiency and effectiveness.

section.text: For the purposes of this Act, the following definitions apply:

paragraph.text: The term County means Storey County, Nevada.
The term Federal land means the approximately 1,745 acres of Federal land identified on the map as BLM Owned - County Request Transfer.
The term map means the map titled Restoring Storey County Act and dated July 24, 2012.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the Bureau of Land Management.

section.header: Conveyance of Federal land in Storey County, Nevada

subsection.header: Conveyance of Federal land in Virginia City
subsection.text: Not later than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall convey to the County, by quitclaim deed, all surface rights of the United States in and to the Federal land, including any improvements thereon. All costs associated with the conveyance under this section shall be the responsibility of the Bureau of Land Management.

No conveyance or combination of conveyances made under this section shall be considered a major Federal action for purposes of
section 102(2) of the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4332(2)) and the National Historic Preservation Act shall not apply to any conveyance made under this section or to the real property, including improvements thereon, so conveyed.
